panels.description: Casper Era is 2 hours. Please give this plot time to settle and produce smooth rectangle.
panels.title: Era Flow

panels.description:
Old method < 1.4.4

This is a histogram metric, so it averages up before we get a real value. 

Nodes that are working well hit sub 20s. With 32.7 s blocks, the commit needs to be 60% of that to not miss a propose after the switch block.
panels.title: Performance ( Old < 1.4.4 )

panels.description: Below 12 is where all good healthy values are. Everything above will lead to networks degradation. If current setup doesn't fit in to ecosystem requirements, please  consider migration on better hardware, key factors for now are mostly IO, enterprise grade large NVMe storage is good starting point, nevertheless modern CPU and RAM are highly appreciated and will improve performance significantly.
panels.title: Performance ( New => 1.4.4 )

panels.description:
This is a histogram metric, so it averages up before we get a real value.  This is the current best indicator of your node performance. 

Nodes that are working well hit sub 20s. With 32.7 s blocks, the commit needs to be 60% of that to not miss a propose after the switch block.

Give this plot some time to produce smooth stable waveform.

panels.title: Alert Example:  Chain Flow

panels.description:
Casper Era is 2 hours. Please give this plot time to settle and produce smooth rectangle.

Alerts doesn't support variables, specify particular instances.

Check if era change in [range], if not this mean we halt or validator have serious issue. We use 3 hour here as a time frame.
panels.title: Alert Example: Era Flow

panels.description:
Alerts doesn't support variables, specify particular instances.

Below 12 is where all good healthy values are. Everything above will lead to networks degradation. If current setup doesn't fit in to ecosystem requirements, please  consider migration on better hardware, key factors for now are mostly IO, enterprise grade large NVMe storage is good starting point, nevertheless modern CPU and RAM are highly appreciated and will improve performance significantly.
panels.title: Alert Example: Performance
